title: White House warns Republicans that Ukraine faces diminishing funds
description: Negotiations on a new aid package have stalled in Congress, with Republicans linking it to domestic policy matters such as cuts to tax services and restrictive immigration legislation.

title: Zelensky abruptly cancels planned video meeting with US Senators
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer revealed that the Ukrainian president's scheduled speech to US Senators – before their pivotal vote on a $60+ billion aid package for Kyiv – was unexpectedly canceled without explanation.

title: What is Hamas's next step?
description: In interviews with Le Monde, leaders of the Islamist movement in Lebanon and Qatar promise to continue the fight against Israel in the absence of a political agreement.

title: Women's football: Scotland takes on England amid bizarre Olympic predicament
description: For the British women's team to play at the Paris 2024 Games, England must beat their potential Olympic teammates, Scotland, on Tuesday.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon's permanent conflict strategy
description: The La France Insoumise leader, who has gone from polemic to polemic, once again caused a stir when he described television journalist Ruth Elkrief as a 'manipulator' and a 'fanatic' on Sunday, December 3.

title: Malala: 'The Taliban have made girlhood illegal'
description: The keynote speaker of the 21st Nelson Mandela Annual Lecture, Nobel Peace Prize laureate Malala Yousafzai delivered a speech calling for Afghanistan's 'gender apartheid' to be made a crime against humanity.

title: World Health Organization declares Gaza is reaching 'humanity's darkest hour'
description: Bombings in previously safe southern areas, hastily displaced warehouses and critical shortages of medicine, beds and sanitation: The WHO and other UN agencies report an 'increasing disaster' in Gaza.

title: Ukraine opens arms procurement corruption investigation
description: Oleksandr Klymenko, anti-corruption prosecution head, spoke of 'from €10-100 million' in contracts under investigation, but Kyiv has sworn that there was no 'misuse' of Western arms sent to fight the war against Russia.

title: Ireland to vote on removing women 'in the home' mention from constitution
description: In two referendums on International Women's Day on March 8, Ireland will vote to replace language described as 'outdated' by the government from the Constitution.

title: UK and Rwanda strike new treaty, hoping to unblock controversial asylum plan
description: British Home Secretary James Cleverly visited Rwanda to sign a new deal, after the British Supreme Court ruled last month that the UK's policy of sending asylum-seekers to Rwanda was unlawful.

title: French secondary school students' results drop post-pandemic, as elsewhere
description: Overall scores fell sharply in the OECD's flagship PISA study, reflecting the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on education. In France, the trend is more marked than average, particularly in mathematics and reading.

title: How office tools like Slack and Teams create the illusion of productivity
description: New digital managerial tools and innovations, which are supposed to promote efficiency within a team, can prevent employees from focusing on the core of their work by increasing demands made on their attention.

title: Israel pushes its military offensive to southern Gaza
description: After the week-long truce between Israel and Hamas, fighting has spread to Khan Yunis, the largest town in the south of the enclave. For the trapped Palestinians, the humanitarian crisis is worsening.

title: The use of opaque algorithms facilitates abuses within public services
description: Automated data processing is increasingly used by public services, and there are few safeguards.

title: CO₂ emissions continue to rise in a world still heavily dependent on fossil fuels
description: Emissions from coal, oil and gas continue to rise in 2023, warns the Global Carbon Project. They are soaring sharply in China, the world's largest emitter, while declining in the United States and Europe.

title: War in Ukraine: The complicated evacuation of the wounded from the frontline
description: While the number of wounded soldiers, like that of the deceased, is kept secret by the Ukrainian government, it amounts to tens of thousands of men, increasingly subjected to Russia's firepower. Society cares what happens to them.

title: After Paris attack, debate centers on psychiatric monitoring of radicalized individuals
description: Armand Rajabpour-Miyandoab, the psychologically fragile ex-prisoner who killed one person and injured two near the Eiffel Tower on Saturday, had interrupted his treatment in March 2022. Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin spoke of a 'psychiatric failure.'

title: French Assemblée Nationale votes to ban single-use e-cigs
description: The disposable electronic cigarettes popular with teenagers are under scrutiny as a new source of trash. The bill now heads to the Sénat.

title: Record number of fossil fuel lobbyists at COP28 talks, report NGOs
description: Taken as a group, lobbyists outnumber 'every country delegation' apart from Brazil and the UAE, a coalition of NGOs said in a statement.

title: Juanita Castro, exiled opposition leader and sister of Cuban leaders Fidel and Raul, dies at 90
description: Juanita Castro fled Cuba in 1964 after relations irrevocably broke down with her brothers Fidel and Raul due to the 1959 revolution.

title: How an algorithm decides which French households to audit for benefit fraud
description: Through a freedom of information request, Le Monde obtained the code of the algorithm used to calculate the 'risk score' of social benefit recipients – their supposed likelihood of committing fraud, based on characteristics such as age, family situation or income.

title: Dutch anti-money laundering operation results in over a thousand global arrests
description: The police and judicial services working since June identified 10,736 fraudulent transactions. According to Europol, the operation has prevented the concealment of €32 million.

title: Shadow of anti-Semitism fractures student community in French universities
description: Dozens of anti-Semitic acts on university campuses have been reported since Hamas's October 7 attack. Far-left collectives claim to be 'anti-Zionist' in the name of 'anti-colonialism.'

title: The British government wants to drastically reduce legal migration to the UK
description: The new policy, aimed at reducing annual arrivals by at least 300,000 people, could exacerbate staff shortages in the health and welfare sectors, in particular.

title: A Gazan museum takes shape in the clouds at the Arab World Institute
description: The HAWAF Collective, which is taking part in the Paris exhibition 'What Palestine Brings to the World,' is sketching the outlines of a virtual museum in Gaza.

title: White House warns that a lack of aid might tilt the Ukraine conflict in Putin's favor
description: The Biden administration on Monday urged Congress to approve billions in aid for Ukraine, stating that without it, Kyiv's defense against Russia's invasion could falter.
